content.full_text:
Abraham Lincoln to Converse & Priest, 1 October 18471 If you will let MrE. G. Johnshave any amount of oil not exceeding ten dollars in value, I will pay you the money
               for it in three months from date
paragraphs: Abraham Lincoln to Converse & Priest, 1 October 18471

If you will let MrE. G. Johnshave any amount of oil not exceeding ten dollars in value, I will pay you the money
               for it in three months from date

footnotes.text: 1Abraham Lincoln wrote and signed the letter.

2The editors were unable to identify a business with this name inSpringfield, Illinois, where both Lincoln and Edmund G. Johns lived. It may refer to “Priest’s Oil Factory,”
                  which advertised in a Springfield newspaper in October 1847.Illinois Journal(Springfield), 21 October 1847, 3:3.
